column4: has anyone here ever used win32 on a computer that used to have a 32 bit proccessor, then upgraded to 64-bit?
hmm, it says to me "hardware change, bla" and it gives the Safe Mode, Safe Mode with command prompt, reboot with last known good config settings page, ya'll know the one. anyone ever had that?
oh and i found the way to remove a broken OS from the boot menu if anyone wants to know, ask me and i will tell ^^
does anyone know why when i install ubuntu and kubuntu on the same pc, same versions and same settings, ubuntu reads "Buffer I/O Error on device HDC"?
how did you installed them exactly?
indeed, i take out the cd then it asks me to put it back in
it says it cant install some packages. most get thru ok, but some random ones don't work
try install them without the cd
how can i install without the cd?
sudo pico /etc/apt/sources.list and add a # to the line of the cd (the first i think), then go to ubuntuguide.org and read the part about enabling extra repositories
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install kubuntu
it has installed weird, it gives me command line and i can do sudo commands and stuff
that i will try, its almost finished installing kubuntu as a test ^^
kubuntu isnt wort it :D im afraid
i don't like kubuntu, that's why i have this problem :( i started with it then wanted to install ubuntu. spent 3 days trying
i have just reinstalled kub to see if it was hardware or software
you can just install ubuntu and then sudo apt-get install kubuntu
